variants.Description in input context: L347P (unstable, fails to reconstitute YFP - Parkin recruitment to depolarized mitochondria)
A168P (fails to reconstitute YFP - Parkin recruitment to depolarized mitochondria at 3 h)
H271Q (fails to reconstitute YFP - Parkin recruitment to depolarized mitochondria at 3 h)
G309D (only partially reconstitutes YFP - Parkin recruitment to depolarized mitochondria)
G411S (reconstitutes YFP - Parkin recruitment to a similar extent as wild - type PINK1)
R42P (moderate deficit in Parkin recruitment to depolarized mitochondria, moderate loss in mitophagy activity)
R46P (moderate deficit in Parkin recruitment to depolarized mitochondria, moderate loss in mitophagy activity)
I44A (moderate deficit in Parkin recruitment to depolarized mitochondria)
C253Y (completely disrupts recruitment at 1 h of CCCP treatment, severe mitophagy deficit)
C289G (completely disrupts recruitment at 1 h of CCCP treatment, severe mitophagy deficit, some recruitment after 24 h of CCCP exposure)
C441R (completely disrupts recruitment at 1 h of CCCP treatment, severe mitophagy deficit, some recruitment after 24 h of CCCP exposure)
C332S (completely disrupts recruitment at 1 h of CCCP treatment, severe mitophagy deficit, no membrane translocation detectable by Western blotting)
Q311X (completely disrupts recruitment at 1 h of CCCP treatment, severe mitophagy deficit)
T415X (completely disrupts recruitment at 1 h of CCCP treatment, severe mitophagy deficit)
K211N (blocks recruitment of Parkin to mitochondria, severe mitophagy deficit)
C212Y (blocks recruitment of Parkin to mitochondria, severe mitophagy deficit)
R275W (mild deficit in recruitment, severe deficit in mitophagy)

Material used.Material Name: HeLa YFP - Parkin, E18 Rat cortical neurons, PINK1 +/+ SV40 - transformed MEF cells, PINK1 2/2 SV40 - transformed MEF, M17 neuroblastoma control shRNA, M17 neuroblastoma PINK1, Mfn1/2 2/2 MEF, Parl 2/2 MEF cell lines, PINK1 +/+ and PINK1 2/2 primary MEFs, Parkin +/+ - and Parkin 2/2 - transformed MEFs
Material used.Description: Multiple cell lines and primary cells from different genetic backgrounds were used as described in the text for confocal microscopy experiments.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Qualitative (scoring of Parkin recruitment and Parkin - induced mitophagy) and Quantitative (time to Parkin translocation in live - cell imaging)

Readout description.Result Description: For PINK1 variants: L347P fails to reconstitute YFP - Parkin recruitment; A168P and H271Q do not reconstitute YFP - Parkin recruitment at 3 h; G309D only partially reconstitutes YFP - Parkin recruitment; G411S reconstitutes YFP - Parkin recruitment similar to wild - type PINK1. For Parkin variants: R42P, R46P, I44A have moderate deficits in recruitment; C253Y, C289G, C441R, C332S, Q311X, T415X, K211N, C212Y completely disrupt recruitment at 1 h (with some later recruitment for C289G and C441R); R275W has a mild deficit in recruitment. For mitophagy, wild - type Parkin induces mitophagy; R42P, R46P have moderate loss in mitophagy activity; C253Y, C289G, C441R, C332S, Q311X, T415X, K211N, C212Y, R275W have severe mitophagy deficits.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed in three or more independent experiments as described throughout the text.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: p - values were used to compare differences between groups (e.g., p - value < 0.001 for comparing Parkin recruitment in different cell lines with different PINK1 expression or mutant conditions)

Material used.Material Name: Same as in confocal microscopy experiments
Material used.Description: Multiple cell lines and primary cells from different genetic backgrounds were used for immunoblotting and immunocytochemistry experiments.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Qualitative (protein bands on immunoblots, protein localization in immunocytochemistry)

Readout description.Result Description: For PINK1, changes in protein levels in different cell fractions (e.g., mitochondrial - rich membrane fraction, cytosolic fraction) were observed under different treatment conditions. For Parkin, changes in its localization to mitochondria (increase in mitochondrial - rich membrane fraction and decrease in supernatant) were observed under depolarizing conditions. Different PINK1 and Parkin mutants showed different patterns of protein stability and localization.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed in multiple independent experiments as described in the text.

Material used.Description: HeLa cells were used to measure relative PINK1 mRNA expression levels.
